parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
